intro: Astragalus diopogon, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, linear leaflets that are often covered in fine hairs. Astragalus diopogon is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
